Trial_Design.evidence: 297 GIBS patients undergoing endovascular aneurysm repair

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess pre-endovascular repair anatomical characteristics of aortoiliac aneurysm

Method_Outcome.evidence: Measurements included total iliac artery length, common iliac artery length, tortuosity index, common iliac artery splay angle, internal iliac artery stenosis, calcification score, and diameters in the device's landing zone.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 297 GIBS patients undergoing endovascular aneurysm repair

Result_Outcome.evidence: Left total iliac artery length was shorter than right (6.7 mm, P = .0019); right common iliac artery less tortuous ( P = .0145).
